page.title: 13LOCAL DIALECT
page.content: There is little doubt that over the past 20 yrs. the once strong Norfolk dialect has faded in Hockwold, probably due to wider travel,marriages to non villagers, "outsiders" moving into the new housing estates and the influence of radio and T.V. Some vowels have always differed from the Norwich area eg{goin to Narwich,}in Hockwold{Norwich.}The village borders the county of Suffolk and this may account for the differing vowels.{Grut {ole mawther}(adult female) is seldom heard now but a male is still a{rum {ole bore.}Sentences such as{Shall us {go to yours}({yars}in North Norfolk) or{moin?}or{Oim nowa goen}are still commonly used. The true dialect is only kept alive by the older citizens and specific words by the farming community.
